tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 268 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and generating value through card draw and direct damage spells. By utilizing cheap artifact creatures such as Myr Enforcer and Refurbished Familiar, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive game plan. The inclusion of cards like Ichor Wellspring and Thoughtcast helps to keep the hand full and maintain a steady stream of threats. Galvanic Blast provides the finishing touch by dealing direct damage to the opponent's creatures or life total. The mana base consists of artifact lands to power up the deck's affinity mechanic and ensure smooth mana curve.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Fireblast, while also utilizing cards like Sneaky Snacker and Guttersnipe to add extra damage whenever spells are cast. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize, using aggressive creatures like Kessig Flamebreather to close out the game if necessary. The deck also includes card draw and removal options to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to have control over the game with a combination of removal spells and creature sacrifice effects. By using various ways to generate tokens and gain life, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Pestilence and Cauldron Familiar allows for incremental advantage while setting up for a strong end game. The mana base is focused on producing the necessary colors to cast spells while also utilizing Khalni Garden to generate additional creatures for sacrifice or defense.

The deck focuses on playing fast and aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes cheap creatures like Goblin Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary, as well as direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to efficiently remove threats and chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, support cards like Wrenn's Resolve and Rally at the Hornburg help to buff the creatures and provide extra reach to close out the game. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a consistent stream of damage.

The deck focuses on maintaining a low mana curve and playing aggressively with cheap creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Brinebarrow Intruder. It utilizes tempo plays and card advantage through cards like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Of One Mind, while also including counterspells like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell to control the opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly develop a board presence, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game before they can stabilize.

Utilizing low-cost creatures with abilities that gain value when they enter the battlefield or die, this Rakdos Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats and removal spells. By leveraging efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, along with cards that provide card advantage like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize, this deck seeks to disrupt opponents' plans while applying constant pressure. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while also providing some utility with Bojuka Bog and Rakdos Carnarium.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost, aggressive creatures and using burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It aims to swarm the board with creatures like Goblin Bushwhacker and Voldaren Epicure while dealing direct damage with Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast. The inclusion of cards like Rally at the Hornburg and Wrenn's Resolve allow for additional creature buffs and protection. The deck's game plan is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, utilizing the synergy between cheap creatures and efficient burn spells.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures and buffing them with various enchantments to create a powerful and aggressive White Weenie aggro strategy. The key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small but potent creatures supported by a range of enchantments to enhance their abilities and make them difficult to deal with. The deck aims to establish control early in the game through efficient creature deployment and powerful enchantments, pushing for a fast victory against opponents in a Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of the deck is to use Balustrade Spy along with other creatures like Saruli Caretaker and Generous Ent to quickly mill through your deck, putting creatures into your graveyard. Once you have enough creatures in your graveyard, you can use Dread Return to bring back a powerful creature like Lotleth Giant for a game-winning combo. The deck also includes cards like Wall of Roots and Gatecreeper Vine to help ramp up mana and find the necessary pieces to execute the combo efficiently.

The main focus of this Pauper 1 vs 1 deck is to apply consistent pressure on the opponent by dealing early damage with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, while also taking advantage of "rummage" effects like Faithless Looting to maintain card advantage. The deck also includes creatures like Thermo-Alchemist and Voldaren Epicure to provide additional damage over time. Highway Robbery and Grab the Prize serve as additional resources to ramp up burn damage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total and finish the game before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and creatures with disruptive abilities. By using cards like Counterspell, Essence Scatter, and Spell Pierce to disrupt your opponent's game plan, combined with removal spells like Cast Down and Snuff Out to deal with threats, this deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy and gain card advantage. Additionally, the deck utilizes creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Ninja of the Deep Hours to provide additional disruption and card advantage, ultimately leading to a victory through control and attrition.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells and removing threats, while also benefiting from the Gate cards to fix mana and generate card advantage. The key strategy is to stall the game with removal spells and efficient creatures like Sacred Cat and Squadron Hawk, while using counterspells to protect key threats like Guardian of the Guildpact. The deck also includes card draw with Brainstorm and LÃ³rien Revealed, allowing for consistent access to important cards. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through incremental advantage.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth to play big creatures like Annoyed Altisaur and Avenging Hunter. Writhing Chrysalis and Suplex provide removal options while Thunderhead Gunner offers direct damage to opponents. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with large threatening creatures and fast mana production to control the battlefield and deliver quick damage. Jewel Thief can also disrupt opponents' plans by stealing their artifacts.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing a combination of cheap threats like Gixian Infiltrator and Krark-Clan Shaman, along with powerful removal such as Cast Down and Cleansing Wildfire, this deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Nyxborn Hydra and Lembas provide additional versatility and resilience. Overall, this deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and controlling the game tempo to secure victory.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on efficiently removing opponent's threats while deploying its own creatures quickly to apply pressure. With a mix of removal spells like Cast Down and Suffocating Fumes, along with value creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk, the deck aims to establish board control and chip away at the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Fanatical Offering and Grim Bauble provide additional utility and card advantage to maintain momentum in the game. The deck's mana base ensures consistent access to both white and black mana sources for optimal card usage.

The deck focuses on creating a fast, aggressive strategy with low-cost creature cards to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By equipping these creatures with various auras and enchantments to boost their power and protection, the goal is to maintain a constant pressure on the opponent while also ensuring the creatures survive combat. The inclusion of evasion abilities and protection spells further enhances the deck's ability to push through damage efficiently. This deck aims to win the game swiftly by delivering a steady stream of damage while maintaining a strong board presence.
